115080008.text: A construct made from a data stream. Many believe they're linked to Stellarons and the Fragmentum phenomenon.

115080009.text: What we refer to as relics are objects corroded by the Fragmentum whose data is saved and then reconstructed.

115080012.text: ...You could consult Herta. She's an expert in relic research.

111090000.text: @{NICKNAME} @March 7th @Dan Heng, the sealing of the Stellaron is complete, and the spatial distortion is dissipating. Good job.

111090003.text: Don't rush, go at your own pace. The Express will be here, before you're ready to leave.

111090005.text: I'm craving some juice... Pom-Pom still owes me a glass!

111090007.text: Not great. Even though the influence of the Stellaron has basically subsided, the existing Fragmentum is too deeply rooted.

111090008.text: The Eternal Freeze has lasted a very long time, enough to severely impact the ecology of the planet.

111090009.text: In short, the planet probably won't regain the vitality that it once had a thousand years ago in such a short time.

111090011.text: Is there anything else we can do?
111090011.option: Is there anything else we can do?

111090012.text: ...As Trailblazers, our mission has already concluded successfully. The fate of this world should be handed back to its inhabitants.

111090013.text: Humankind has always struggled against austere conditions and had always managed to thrive in spite of it. Now that the Eternal Freeze is gone, the Fragmentum has lost its momentum to expand.

111090014.text: Jarilo-VI will be revitalized. Believe in the perseverance of her people.

111090015.text: I detected a high-frequency spatial energy surge in the north of Jarilo-VI. You might be interested in checking it out.

111090016.text: Don't worry. That energy is not related to the Stellaron. It's only an Echo left behind after spatial distortions fade away.

111090017.text: Inside the Echo, our perceptions of space and time that we are used to will become radically altered, to the point where it might even reconstruct certain scenes from our own past experiences.

111090018.text: If you're in the mood and wish to re-live those memorable adventures, you can try your luck at places where Echoes can be found.

111090002.text: We'll need to stay here a little longer
111090002.option: We'll need to stay here a little longer

111110000.text: {NICKNAME}, March, Dan Heng... How was your rest?

111110001.text: Pom-Pom has completed the routine pre-departure inspection, so the Nameless is ready to move on to the next world. Come back to the Express when you've tied up all the loose ends

111110002.text: Oh, right. You must have so many questions about that final battle with the Supreme Guardian of Belobog. Welt and I made some simple analyses that might help shed some light on it for you

111110003.text: Got it! We will start our preparations now

121730002.text: {NICKNAME} and I heard you received an anonymous letter, and we were worried, so we came here to check on you, but you weren't in the archives.

121730003.text: Did that poker-faced Stellaron Hunter "Blade" give you any trouble again?

121730004.text: Don't worry. I just stepped away to enjoy the view.

121730008.text: By the way, don't forget to head back to the Express early. Himeko said she made coffee for us.

121730005.text: Don't worry. I just stepped away for a bit to catch up with some old friends.
121730005.option: I went to meet some old friends.

121730006.text: Don't worry. I've got rid of that letter.

130010006.text: Are we ready to set off to the next stop?

130010007.text: We sure are! The warp jump device is all calibrated.

130010008.text: But, as the Express conductor, I have three things I wanted to stress before we depart.

130010009.text: That's why I'm here for this little Express meeting, too.

130010010.text: Alright! Then you know the rules.

130010011.text: We'll meet in the Parlor Car!

130010005.text: Alright, let's see what the conductor has to say first.

130030000.text: Himeko invited {NICKNAME}, March, and Welt to join the group chat

130030004.text: It doesn't feel very real. It's odd. I can't describe it

130030005.text: We're in a dream, after all
130030005.option: We're in a dream, after all

130030007.text: I saw a guy wearing a plaster head sculpture at the auction, and he walked off without doing anything. That's pretty suspicious

130030008.text: I also had some unpleasant discoveries. It's a bit complicated. It's best if we meet up face-to-face.

130030010.text: Looks like a trip back to reality is overdue

130030011.text: Let's meet up in my room

130210001.text: You still at hotel in the dreamscape?

130210005.text: We got separated in the Memory Zone, but {NICKNAME} is with the Memokeeper

130210009.text: Do I need to get off the Express and help?

130210011.text: Sure. Just let me know if you need me

130210012.text: The Reverie Hotel in the real world is very calm. Not much is happening.

130210014.text: I finished investigating on my side.

130210020.text: That lady didn't do anything bad, did she?

130210021.text: I'm sorry... about what happened to Firefly.

130210022.text: The scene has been cordoned off by The Family. We're wrapping up negotiations with some Family delegates.

130210023.text: Let's meet somewhere near the Clockie Statue later.

130210016.text: I finished investigating on my side.

130210017.text: Where should I go to meet you?

130300000.text: Looks like a trip back to reality is overdue

130300001.text: Let's meet up in my room

130300002.text: I've run into a little trouble...
130300002.option: I've run into a little trouble...

130640001.text: Got a package delivered to the Express

130640003.text: I do recall the Express has received one of these things before, no?

130640005.text: What kind of package? So mysterious

130640006.text: Yes. The Express' records did mention this has happened before.

130640008.text: Oh, that thing. I remember now

130640009.text: {NICKNAME}, this is some good stuff. You better get back and have a look!

130640010.text: This is a gift specifically for me.
130640010.option: I already know what to expect

130640016.text: This is a package sent to the Express from another Nameless in the cosmos

130640019.text: Remember to take a look once you get back to the Express

130640020.text: I'll be there soon. I'm about to reach a Space Anchor
130640020.option: Got it. I'm on my way

130640023.text: No problem. What if the conductor doesn't know either?

130640024.text: Hmph. Pom-Pom thinks you're the one that doesn't have a clue

130640026.text: Actually, I already saw the package. Your message came a bit late, conductor

130640027.text: You're the one who replied late, {NICKNAME}

130640013.text: Does it say who's supposed to receive it? Does it have {NICKNAME}'s name on it?

130760000.text: Mr. Yang, our investigation here has come to an end

130760001.text: How's progress going on your end?

130760002.text: Not too bad. The Galaxy Ranger and I agree that The Family might be hiding something extremely important.

130760003.text: We're now headed to Dewlight Pavilion.

130760004.text: Acheron, huh? Didn't Aventurine say she was dangerous...

130760005.text: I've confirmed that she's on our side.

130760006.text: Don't worry. Please wait for a while. I'll keep you posted as soon as I find anything.

122330001.text: I have something important to announce

122330002.text: We're going to be getting wages after this? Awesome!

122330003.text: Sadly, no. That's not been planned yet

122330004.text: The budget for the Nameless' expenditures will still be managed solely by the navigator for the time being. If there is a need among individual passengers, however, you can come to apply for an additional allowance from me

122330005.text: Speaking of which, why doesn't Mr. Yang ever seem to worry about money...

122330017.text: Ahem. To business. The thing I wanted to tell everyone is that the Astral Express will soon be one of the shareholders of the Penacony Conglomerate

122330018.text: The Family and the IPC will begin formal negotiations soon regarding the Dreamscape's reconstruction plans and commercial projects for the future

122330019.text: After this round of investments, the IPC will hold <unbreak>30%</unbreak> of Penacony's shares

122330020.text: And the Strategic Investment Department managed to secure a significant boon for us: When the financing is done, the IPC will transfer 5% of the stocks to the Astral Express to express their sincerity in developing a long-term partnership with the Nameless

122330022.text: Though I don't know much about shares or options... It sounds pretty great!

122330023.text: I'm more curious about how future dividends will be calculated?

122330024.text: So, does that mean we're gonna get financial independence and early retirement soon?

122330025.text: Oh, my. Have you been living in poverty this entire time, {NICKNAME}? You must have had it rough

122330029.text: As the ceaselessly trailblazing Nameless, we got another responsibility to shoulder regarding this agreement

122330030.text: As shareholders of the Penacony Conglomerate, we must bear the duty of being brand ambassadors and ensure the Planet of Festivities will no longer depart from the proper path of Harmony

122330031.text: It's time to make everyone submit
122330031.option: Time to wield my shareholder power!

122330033.text: It's time for everyone to remember our name!

122330034.text: Oh, it seems like {NICKNAME} is full of energy!

122330038.text: I can tell {F#her}{M#his} determination from the words {F#she}{M#he} typed. We can't stop {F#her}{M#him}.

122330039.text: It's time to make everyone submit

122330027.text: Clearly, your financial acumen is about on par with March 7th's.

122330008.text: The food options on the dining menu are about to be updated? The day has finally come!

122330009.text: Does Passenger {NICKNAME} have some points of dissatisfaction to raise about the current menu?

122330010.text: I guess {F#she}{M#he} is probably about to complain about the pre-made meals again!

122330011.text: Then, let me give a piece of personal advice: Stop scrolling through food blogger videos

122330012.text: Alright, I'll spill. It is I who borrowed away Dan Heng's neck massager

122330014.text: By the way, "borrowing" is when you let someone know. If you don't, that's called "stealing."

122330015.text: It's just a massager. If {NICKNAME} wants one, we can order one

122330016.text: I checked the price as well. Let's leave the bill with {NICKNAME}

122350000.text: I just received a gift. It got sent to {TEXTJOIN#87}

122350001.text: Aventurine sent it. This was inside

122350003.text: Oh, it's a model. That brand is renowned for making quality products. If I'm not mistaken, this is a limited edition.

122350005.text: {NICKNAME}, open the windows! Are there figures of us inside?

122350006.text: This is a miniature of the Express. Looking at the exterior, I don't think it's designed to be opened.

122350007.text: I used to collect models back home. Based on my experience, if there are additional accessories, they are usually displayed separately.

122350008.text: Wow! Where did you get that? It's so pretty! I want one too. Shouldn't there be one for the conductor?

122350009.text: You'll have to ask @{NICKNAME} about that

122350010.text: Doesn't seem like it. There are only some other snacks and beverages in the package

122350011.text: Maybe your packages are still on the way... I only received this one

122350012.text: I don't have a package tracking number...

122350013.text: I didn't receive anything either. Looks like {NICKNAME} is the only one who got it.

122350014.text: I'll take the snacks if you don't want them!

122350015.text: We shouldn't give the conductor too much junk food. We'll be in trouble if they get the runs.

122350017.text: Jokes aside, this looks like it's specially prepared for {NICKNAME}

122350018.text: When we did the handover for {TEXTJOIN#87} with The Family, we came to a consensus that the ownership of the ship should belong to the Express passenger who contributed the most to Penacony

122350019.text: In other words, {TEXTJOIN#87} only has one owner right now, and that is {NICKNAME}. This gift is just for you

122350020.text: Ah? Then I'll gladly accept it!
122350020.option: Thanks! Don't mind if I do!

122350021.text: Take it. It's what you deserve.

122350023.text: Hang on, I'm going to get a lottery ticket now. We'll share the winnings among us

122350024.text: Even if we win the grand prize, you're more than deserving of it!

122350025.text: I think... it'll be more suitable if we give this to Pom-Pom.
122350025.option: We should give it to Pom-Pom instead.

122350026.text: Pom-Pom is the conductor after all, and the conductor should be in charge of the Express.

122350028.text: Pom-Pom doesn't want it! It's yours. Pom-Pom is just happy to be with all you passengers.

122400001.text: Hey fam... I won a prize!
122400001.option: I got a souvenir from a game I played.

122400002.text: Actually, it's a souvenir I got from a game I played. It's some kind of television!

122400003.text: Who wants to see it? I'll carry it into the Parlor Car right now!

122400007.text: Congratulations to {NICKNAME} for winning a television

122400008.text: Looks like you've reaped quite a few rewards from Penacony

122400010.text: Wait. Why haven't I experienced anything like this? I was at Penacony too! You're just too lucky, {NICKNAME}

122400011.text: Do you want to place it in the Parlor Car? Once do you do, let me know. I wanna touch it. See if I smooch some luck off you

122400013.text: Wait! Hold on! You can't put this in the Parlor Car!

122400016.text: Why not? Won't it be good for everyone to watch some TV on the couch?

122400017.text: Hmm. TV and coffee. That just might bring out the taste of home

122400018.text: The Parlor Car is a place to enjoy the stellar view. Pom-Pom has strict rules and regulations for every section of the Express. If we put the TV there, then it'll be the entertainment car, and that clashes with the enjoyment of scenery.

122400019.text: That's right. If we do this, the Parlor Car will have the Phonograph and a TV. It'll start disturbing everyone else

122400020.text: Alright... If even the Passengers don't think this is a good idea, {NICKNAME} just won't leave it there! That should do it, right?

122400022.text: Pom-Pom's speech pattern is not that exaggerated. Anyway, this isn't what's important

122400029.text: You can put it straight in the Passenger Cabin, {NICKNAME}

122400030.text: It's where the long corridor leads to that armchair. You can place it on the cabinet nearby so everyone can watch it

122400031.text: I see... You planned this out already, Pom-Pom. No wonder you're the conductor

122400033.text: If we get the chance, we can have a movie night with the television every now and then

122400034.text: You can watch some of the animations I've made in my homeworld. Some of the content is better viewed on a screen

122400035.text: Mr. Yang... Please don't fall asleep again...

122400038.text: Hm. I'm curious about the television, too. Penacony's devices have some special properties. I don't know if they can still persist beyond memoria-infused environments.

122400024.text: Alright, Pom-Pom... You're so strict. I won't put it there

130920000.text: Guys, let's make our way to the Radiant Feldspar

130920001.text: I'll wrap things up soon. Let's meet at the Aft Pool in the stern

130920005.text: By the way, what are you doing on the Radiant Feldspar, Miss Himeko?

130920010.text: Be patient, you'll find out at the opening ceremony

130920006.text: By the way, what have you been up to lately, Miss Himeko?
130920006.option: What have you been up to lately, Miss Himeko?

130920007.text: Hey! I was about to ask the same thing!

130930000.text: Guys, let's make our way to the Radiant Feldspar

130930001.text: I'll wrap things up soon. Let's meet at the Aft Pool in the stern

130930005.text: By the way, what are you doing on the Radiant Feldspar, Miss Himeko?

130930010.text: Be patient, you'll find out at the opening ceremony

130930006.text: By the way, what have you been up to lately, Miss Himeko?
130930006.option: What have you been up to lately, Miss Himeko?

130930007.text: Hey! I was about to ask the same thing!
